intro: Chamaelinum austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian chamaelain, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
